alert.note: Alert for Union (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 11:39AM MST until December 02 at 1:45PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northern Union County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 145 PM MST. * At 1137 AM MST, thick blowing dust was along a line extending from near Capulin to Clayton and Texline. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 70 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 376 and 429. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Des Moines, Folsom, Grenville, Clayton Lake State Park, Seneca, Capulin and Mount Dora. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway during a dust storm. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Never stop in the traveled portion of the roadway.
